node.title: Miami Resident Latest Suspect Detained in Connection to Haitian President Moïse's Assassination
node.description: So far, more than 40 suspects have been detained in connection to Moïse's death, but police have not yet determined a motive.

node.title: Belarus may ask Russia "to get involved" as crisis with EU escalates
node.description: Thousands of migrants and refugees are caught in the middle as Russian-backed Belarus stands accused of trying to fuel tensions in Europe by "weaponizing" immigration.

node.title: Trevor Noah Says Joe Biden's Entire Presidency Could Depend on Gas Prices
node.description: "What's tough for Biden is that it doesn't matter what else he does. If the price of gas stays high, that's that," said Noah.

node.title: COVID outbreak at Connecticut nursing home leaves 8 dead
node.description: Those who died from COVID-19 had "serious underlying health issues," facility leaders said.

node.title: Walmart beats expectations amid supply chain woes and labor costs.
node.description: The strong earnings were driven by growth in the company’s grocery and e-commerce business and its strategy of keeping prices low as inflation rises.

node.title: Retail sales jumped in October in a third straight month of gains.
node.description: The 1.7 percent increase is in part a result of higher prices, but it shows that American consumer spending remains strong.

node.title: What La Niña Means for California’s Drought
node.description: The climate pattern could bring very different fortunes for northern and southern parts of the state.

node.title: Video shows Iran helicopter's "unsafe" maneuver near U.S. warship
node.description: Video published by Iranian media appeared to show the helicopter flying low and coming close to the USS Essex, an amphibious assault ship.

node.title: Hong Kong exempts JPMorgan Chase’s chief from its lengthy quarantine.
node.description: The exemption for Jamie Dimon, who was in town to meet with employees and regulators, was “justified to facilitate a short visit” of about 30 hours, a government spokesman said.

node.title: Kyle Rittenhouse Prosecution 'Scored Major Points' in Their Closing Arguments
node.description: Attorney V. James DeSimone said the prosecution "scored major points" by saying that Rittenhouse didn't need to fire at Joseph Rosenbaum four times if acting in self-defense.

node.title: Closing arguments in Rittenhouse trial focus on claim of self-defense
node.description: Rittenhouse, 18, is charged with killing two men and wounding a third at a protest in Kenosha, Wisconsin.

node.title: Infrastructure bill mandates action on seatback safety after child deaths

node.title: U.S. Beats Mexico and Then Rubs It In
node.description: Christian Pulisic and Weston McKennie scored and the Americans, fueled by a perceived slight, reveled in their third win over their rival this year.

node.title: Google will invest $740 million in Australia, including a research hub.
node.description: After regulatory fights, the search giant pledged to expand its hiring in the country.

node.title: Poland Uses Water Cannons and Tear Gas as Tensions Rise at Belarus Border
node.description: Western leaders have accused President Aleksandr G. Lukashenko of Belarus of using migrants as weapons in an effort to pressure the European Union.

node.title: Bird Flu Symptoms Explained Amid Outbreaks in Europe, Asia
node.description: The flu virus can cause widespread deaths amongst bird populations and make people very sick in the rare cases when it spreads to humans.

node.title: Mike Pence vs Donald Trump: How Their 2024 Chances Compare
node.description: Polls have consistently shown that the former president is the clear favorite to clinch the 2024 Republican nomination.

node.title: Steve Bannon surrenders to face criminal contempt of Congress charges
node.description: The longtime Trump ally turned himself into the FBI on Monday and is expected in court later in the day.

node.title: Pfizer agrees to let others make its experimental COVID-19 pill
node.description: The deal with a U.N.-backed group could make the treatment available to more than half of the world's population.

node.title: Maryland mayor charged with posting revenge porn on Reddit
node.description: Andrew Bradshaw allegedly created multiple Reddit accounts using his alleged victim's name and birthday and used them to upload nude photographs of her.

node.title: 6 teenagers wounded in shooting near Colorado high school

node.title: Which of the following animals appear to be least susceptible to Covid-19?
node.description: Test your science knowledge.

node.title: Oil output is catching up with demand, possibly easing prices, a report says.
node.description: The International Energy Agency said in its monthly report that oil production was picking up in the United States.

node.title: Boy, 6, Hospitalized After Copperhead Snake Bites Him Outside His Home
node.description: Zander Childers was playing basketball in the driveway of his home when he was bitten by the venomous snake.

node.title: Dozens of Yellowstone-Sized Volcanoes Once Drowned Nevada in Thousands of Feet of Lava
node.description: Scientists studying the formation of Sierra Nevada say volcanic eruptions between 40 and 20 million years ago made the Great Basin the highest point in the U.S.

node.title: What Is a Sonic Boom? Here's What Causes It And Why It's Not an Earthquake
node.description: A sonic boom can bring about some of the seismic qualities of an earthquake, but there are some key differences between the two events.

node.title: Makayla Noble Update As Paralyzed Cheerleader Goes Home After Two Months in Hospital
node.description: The Texas cheerleader has been described by her family as "happy but tired" after her journey home. Her return home coincided with Do It For Mak day, organized by supporters.

node.title: China Dodges Genocide Reports as Xi Jinping and Joe Biden Disagree on Human Rights
node.description: The Biden administration has upheld the determination that China's treatment of Uyghurs in Xinjiang amounts to "genocide."

node.title: 'I'm ready': Rising Aussie star moves a step closer to Formula 1 dream

node.title: Bankers expect to see a bump in their bonuses.

node.title: Amazon agrees to pay $500,000 in California over claims that it hid Covid-19 cases from workers.
node.description: The judgment, which is subject to court approval, is in line with a “right to know” law that was designed to keep workers safe in the pandemic.

node.title: Kim Kardashian Outlines 'Cold Machinery' of Death Penalty Ahead of Julius Jones Execution
node.description: The reality television star said she and other advocates were "anxiously awaiting" Oklahoma governor's decision on whether to commute Jones' death sentence.

node.title: Hundreds stung after storms wash scorpions into people's homes
node.description: The storms forced scorpions from their hiding places into many houses across the province.

node.title: U.S.-China Summit Produces Little More Than Polite Words, but They Help
node.description: In a chilly relationship of mutual mistrust, staving off the prospect of a broader conflict between two superpowers counts as progress.

node.title: Who’s to Blame for Rising Prices
node.description: Why do so many things seem to cost more now?

node.title: Labor announces NBN pitch ahead of next federal election
node.description: The federal opposition promises to give 1.5 million homes and businesses access to higher speed internet if Labor wins the next federal election.

node.title: Belarus-Poland border row fuels fear of new migrant crisis in Germany

node.title: Ryan Sets Course for Showdown at Jonestown 'Prison'

node.title: Jailed former Ipswich mayor says he pleaded guilty against advice of lawyers because he 'just wanted it all over with'
node.description: Jailed former Ipswich mayor Paul Pisasale says he went against advice and "didn't want to" fight allegations of corruption, while giving evidence as a witness in a hearing today.

node.title: Uganda rocked by two explosions, killing two people, injuring 24 in Kampala
node.description: Local television station NTV Uganda reports two explosions — one very close to parliament and one near the central police station — with four people critically injured.

node.title: Teacher With COVID Dies Weeks After Husband Sued Hospital Over Ivermectin Refusal
node.description: Tamara Drock, who was admitted to the hospital with COVID, had been placed on a ventilator in September when her condition worsened.

node.title: 'Wait and see': Anxious Forbes residents watch floodwaters rise

node.title: The Indy Ski Pass Lives Up to Its Name

node.title: Kyle Rittenhouse Verdict: Fate of Kenosha Shooter Hinges on This Question

node.description: A young Perth family who had to be rescued from the Simpson Desert after their campervan became bogged have spoken to the ABC about their experience.

node.title: A Colleague Had Covid. Should Our Supervisor Have Told Us?

node.title: How I Became Obsessed With Accidental Time Travel
node.description: The web is awash with ordinary peoples’ stories of “time slips.” Their real magic is what they can tell us about our relationship to time.

node.title: How to Spot a Shooting Star

node.title: Jane Campion Is Taking Cinema to the Darkest Human Places

node.title: Theirs Is a ‘Traditional Untraditional’ Union
node.description: The Tony Award-winning actor Daisy Eagan and her husband Keith Bloom, who are in an open relationship, share how they designed a marriage that works for them.

node.title: In Florida, a Gut Renovation in Shades of Grape

node.title: In Another Trump Book, a Journalist’s Belated Awareness Steals the Show

node.title: How the Greek Revolution of 1821 Led to the Global System of Nation-States

node.title: Bildungsromans From Around the World

node.title: Seven Immigrant Women Who Changed the Way Americans Eat

node.title: The Cutting Mind and Romantic Heart of Elizabeth Hardwick

node.title: The True-Life Inspiration for Dostoyevsky’s Famous Murderer

node.title: Neal Stephenson’s Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World

node.title: Jeanna de Waal Has Already Forgotten About That ‘Diana’ Film

node.description: Zalmay Khalilzad, who stepped down as the envoy for Afghanistan after the U.S. exit, has defended the deal he negotiated with the Taliban during the Trump administration.

node.title: Puppies kept inside pet stores throughout lockdown
